key_themes: AI productivity tailwinds vs. earnings recession risk
Fed rate-cut cycle and monetary easing support
Precious metals outperformance and capital rotation
Treasury market dysfunction and credit stress indicators
Real estate deterioration and systemic deleveraging pressure
risk_factors: Earnings guidance cuts cascading across fintech, software, and pharma trigger mean-reversion sell-off
Treasury delivery fails (8-year highs per Twitter) signal credit system stress beneath low-volatility surface
Geopolitical escalation (Iran, Taiwan) unpriced by complacent VIX (13.60)â€”tail-risk trigger
CME silver margin hike (December 29 per Twitter) catalyzes commodities volatility spillover
Real estate and housing volume collapse (pandemic lows per Twitter) accelerates deleveraging and consumer demand destruction
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Watch $700 call wall (active resistance, 1.4% away) for intraday cap. Support at $670 (active 2.9% level) acts as near-term floor. QQQ: $625-$630 zone represents compressed resistance (0.2-1.0% away, both ACTIVE). If breached, watch $640 (2.6% away). Intraday consolidation most probable; avoid conviction direction until levels break decisively.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Breakout above $700 call wall targets $730-$750 (5.7-8.6% away, dormant resistance). Breakdown below $670 support initiates move toward $645 then $640 put wall (6.6-7.3% away). Swing bias leans bearish because active call hedging at $700 should cap rallies, while accumulating structural deterioration (earnings, credit stress) favors lower prices over next 1-5 days. QQQ: $630 call wall is final resistance; $625 and $640 represent sequential resistance. Breakdown below $625 targets $590-$585 put wall (5.4-6.2% away). Max pain at $621 suggests week-end gravity toward that level.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
